title: Gigi Hadid and sister Bella rock yee-haw vibes backstage at Kacey Musgraves' Radio City concert
text:
Kacey Musgraves has become one of the biggest names in music, practically redefining the country genre.

And it would appear that some of the singer's biggest fans are supermodel sisters Gigi and Bella Hadid.

They took to their Instagram stories Wednesday as they attended Musgraves' concert at Radio City Music Hall in New York City.

Fan girls: Gigi and Bella Hadid took to their Instagram stories Wednesday as they attended Kacey Musgraves' concert at Radio City Music Hall in New York City

The sisters were in attendance at the show with friend and fellow superfan Olivia Perez.

Bella posted footage of them as they sang along to the artist's hit tracks Space Cowboy and Wonder Woman.

The ladies also hung out backstage with Musgraves before and after the performance.

Bella was beaming in one photo as she struck a pose in the vanity mirror of the dressing room.

Singalong: Bella posted footage of them as they sang along to the artist's hit tracks Space Cowboy and Wonder Woman

Backstage pass: Bella was beaming in one photo as she struck a pose backstage in the vanity mirror of the dressing room

Yee-haw vibes: Another blurry snap shows Gigi trying on a pair of metallic blue boots, appropriately captioned: 'yeehaw'

Boot scootin': She also showed off the boots in a photo of the Radio City Music Hall rug, as they stood outside before the show

Another blurry snap shows Gigi trying on a pair of metallic blue boots, appropriately captioned: 'yeehaw.'

She also showed off the boots in a photo of the Radio City Music Hall rug, as they stood outside before the show.

Gigi took to her story after the show as she lounged around, listening to Musgraves while sporting her t-shirt.

The Texan is currently on the second leg of her Oh, What a World tour, which is headed to Nashville next.

She took home four Grammy Awards this year, including Best Country Album and Album of the Year for Golden Hour.
description: Musgraves is currently on the second leg of her Oh, What a World tour. She took home four Grammy Awards this year, including Best Country Album and Album of the Year for Golden Hour.
